Class JphotoTreeModel

java.lang.Object
  fr.umlv.jphoto.cela.model.JphotoTreeModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.swing.tree.TreeModel
public class JphotoTreeModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.tree.TreeModel

A treemodel with manage the nodes that we display in jphoto's tree.

Author:
cfodouop

getChild

public java.lang.Object getChild(java.lang.Object parent,
                                 int index)
Returns the child of parent at index index in the parent's child array. parent must be a node previously obtained from this data source. This should not return null if index is a valid index for parent (that is index >= 0 && index < getChildCount(parent)).

Specified by:
getChild in interface javax.swing.tree.TreeModel
Parameters:
parent - a node in the tree, obtained from this data source

isLeaf

public boolean isLeaf(java.lang.Object node)
Returns true if node is a leaf. It is possible for this method to return false even if node has no children. A directory in a filesystem, for example, may contain no files; the node representing the directory is not a leaf, but it also has no children.

Specified by:
isLeaf in interface javax.swing.tree.TreeModel
Parameters:
node - a node in the tree, obtained from this data source
Returns:
true if node is a leaf

getPathToRoot

protected AbstractRoot[] getPathToRoot(AbstractRoot node)

getPathToRoot

protected AbstractRoot[] getPathToRoot(boolean fromWhere,
                                       boolean type)
Builds the parents of node up to and including the root node, where the original node is the last element in the returned array. The length of the returned array gives the node's depth in the tree.

Parameters:
fromWhere - tell if insert is initialize from main frame or DialogManager Frame.
type - type of node.
Returns:
an array of AbtsractRoot giving the path from the root to the specified node

insertNewNode

public void insertNewNode(java.lang.Object newChild,
                          boolean fromWhere,
                          boolean type)
Invoked this to insert newChild. This is the preferred way to add children as it will create the appropriate event.

Parameters:
newChild - child
fromWhere - from where we insert this node
type - node's type
